Dates:

Dear EKHLA Families,

Though we are apart right now for our health and safety, we at EKHLA continue to support each other as a community, and right now we must work together to fight COVID-19. In order to help prevent the spread of COVID-19, EKHLA will be reaching out to you via email over the next two weeks to share vitally important guidance.

This guidance is based on what scientists know about how to prevent the spread of COVID-19, and it is our hope that you will continue doing all you can to follow these practices and share them with your friends and family.

Thank you for what you are doing to educate your children at home and all the efforts you’re making to keep your family healthy and safe. We know this is a difficult time. If we stand apart as a community during this stretch and continue following the public health practices we will be sharing over the coming days, we will be back together soon.



Stay well!

Kathryn Davis, Superintendent/Principal

Hello Families,

The EKHLA Board and Administration want to reassure the EKHLA community that we are continually monitoring the outbreak of COVID-19 and its potential impact to the welfare of our students, parents, and staff.

As it stands today, EKHLA will resume classes for all students and staff on Monday, March 16. We will update you if this changes. We will continue to monitor the situation very closely and follow the guidance of city, state, and national health authorities. EKHLA will share any changes to this information via email, our website, and our Facebook page.

We are encouraging any staff members or students to stay home if they are feeling sick or if they have a sick family member in their home.

Thank you,

Kathryn Davis Cohen, EKHLA Superintendent, Principal &

The EKHLA Interact Club is organizing a drive to donate much-needed products to the Roy Maas Youth Alternatives program emergency shelter. The Roy Maas Youth Alternatives offers "services to abused, neglected, and high-risk youth through residential and counseling services." You can find more information about their organization on www.rmya.org.

This year each grade level will be collecting different items. The class with the most items in their category will get a popsicle party. Here is the list for each grade level.

Kindergarten: ToothBrushes

1st Grade: Toothpaste
